references.paper_title: Privlava: synthesizing relational data with foreign keys under differential privacy
references.reason: PrivLava is a key comparative baseline in the paper, representing a state-of-the-art approach to multi-relational data synthesis that ClavaDDPM aims to improve upon.
Synthetic Data Vault is another significant comparative baseline, offering a different approach to multi-relational synthesis that ClavaDDPM is compared against.

references.paper_title: Tabddpm: Modelling tabular data with diffusion models
references.reason: TabDDPM is a crucial component of ClavaDDPM, providing the foundational single-table diffusion model that ClavaDDPM extends to the multi-relational setting.

references.paper_title: Modeling tabular data using conditional gan
references.reason: CTGAN serves as a core single-table generative model used in several baseline methods of the paper, highlighting its importance as a foundational technique in tabular data synthesis.
